business.headline: Diwali shopping on credit cards? Here's how offers can backfireFestive sales and flashy credit card deals may look irresistible, but hidden charges, interest traps and repayment delays can turn Diwali shopping into a debt headache.

Retail inflation drops to 1.54% in September, lowest in over 8 yearsFood inflation remained negative for the fourth consecutive month, with the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) showing a year-on-year decline of 2.28%.

Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion, Peter Howitt win Nobel Prize in Economics 2025The Nobel Prize committee said the trio's research has helped economists and policymakers better understand the roots of economic progress.

Loan rejected despite 750 CIBIL score? 5 hidden reasons revealed by expertEven with a strong CIBIL score of 750, many borrowers face loan rejections. Experts say banks consider several hidden factors beyond your credit score that can impact approval.

Is Diwali bonus taxable for salaried employees? Here's what you must knowAs Diwali draws near, salaried employees across India look forward to festive bonuses and gifts. But not all perks are tax-free, and understanding which ones attract tax is essential to avoid surprises from the Income Tax Department.

LG Electronics IPO GMP rises: Can investors expect 50% listing pop tomorrow?LG IPO: While early chatter hinted at a 50% listing pop, current indicators suggest a slightly more modest, yet still impressive, gain. Read on to know more about the grey market trends, subscription frenzy, and what investors can realistically expect tomorrow.

Crypto rebounds after massive crash. Here's what investors should doThe crypto market has regained lost ground following a sharp crash over the weekend. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and several altcoins are bouncing back, leaving investors to decide their next move carefully.

Gold prices climb again. Will the rally continue till Dhanteras?Gold is once again on the rise, drawing attention from investors and festive buyers alike. With prices touching record levels and global uncertainty at play, many are now wondering if the momentum will carry through to Dhanteras.

Why Tata Capital's weak stock market debut isn't a reason to worryTata Capital IPO: The shares opened at Rs 330 on listing day, roughly 1% above the IPO price of Rs 326—a flat, polite start for what was billed as the biggest public issue of the year.
Tata Capital share price: 2025's biggest IPO makes flat debut on stock marketTata Capital shares listed at Rs 330 on both the NSE and the BSE, opening at a premium of just 1% over its issue price.

Sensex tumbles nearly 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today?Across Asia, markets opened lower, and India wasn't spared either. Profit booking after last week's gains and cautious sentiment ahead of key domestic events like the Tata Capital listing, Q2 earnings, and inflation data added to the drag.

LG Electronics IPO set for a bumper listing tomorrow? Check latest GMPLG Electronics IPO was open for subscription from October 7 to October 9 and saw strong participation across all investor categories.

Sensex, Nifty fall amid US-China tariff tensions; focus on Tata Capital listingThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 300 points in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped around 100 points amid mild profit booking after last week's gains.

Tata Capital share listing today: Will investors see profit from biggest IPO in 2025?The Rs 15,511.87 crore IPO, which opened for subscription on October 6 and closed on October 8, received bids for 65.33 crore shares against 33.34 crore shares on offer, subscribing 1.96 times overall.

What's in a Will? Understanding the power of your last wordFrom Bollywood dramas where brothers turn against each other to real-life stories of families dragged into courtrooms, most of these disputes begin with one missing document, a will.

Why Indians still prefer buying homes during auspicious monthsBuying a home in India is more than just a financial decision — it is an emotional milestone. For many, choosing the right time to invest is as important as picking the right property, with festivals and auspicious dates playing a big role.

BTS' Jungkook surprises Mingyu's livestream, joins pretty woman dance challenge BTS' Jungkook joins SEVENTEEN's Mingyu's Instagram livestream for an impromptu interaction. The pair discuss plans for a joint dance challenge and future livestream together.

Yogi Adityanath congratulates Ravi Kishan, says award inspires UP, Bhojpuri artists Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath shared a message for Ravi Kishan after he won the Filmfare Award for Best Supporting Actor for his performance in 'Laapataa Ladies'.

OTT this week: The Diplomat, Good News and more - What to watch, where and when This week, fans can look forward to some interesting films and shows releasing on streaming platforms. Here's a glimpse at this week's binge-watching guide, featuring political thrillers, documentaries, and crime dramas.

Kajol-Nysa's video from Diwali bash goes viral, fans say they look like sisters Kajol and Nysa Devgan turned heads at Manish Malhotra's Diwali bash in stunning embellished sarees. The mother-daughter duo's glamorous looks went viral as fans gushed over their style and striking resemblance.

KBC 17: Rishab Shetty to appear as guest on Amitabh Bachchan's birthday episode Actor Rishab Shetty is all set to appear as a guest on Amitabh Bachchan-hosted 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. The episode was shot on Bachchan's 83rd birthday and is yet to be aired.

general news.headline: Afghanistan rejects Pak truce bid, denies visas to defence minister, ISI chiefThe visa requests of Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif, ISI chief Asim Malik, and two other Pakistani generals have been rejected three times over the past three days.

PM Modi welcomes Israeli hostages' release, supports Trump's peace effortsPM Modi, in a post on X, said the Israeli hostages' freedom is a tribute to the courage of their families and expressed support for President Trump's efforts to bring peace to the region.

Strategic restraint or missed opportunity? Shashi Tharoor on PM skipping Gaza meetCongress leader Shashi Tharoor said that India's decision to send a Minister of State to the Gaza peace summit in Egypt "stands in stark contrast to the heads of state gathered there".

Indian-origin man, wrongfully jailed in US for 43 years, walks free. Then, a twistAfter spending nearly his entire adult life behind bars, 64-year-old Subramanyam "Subu" Vedam's was barely released from Pennsylvania's Huntingdon State Correctional Institution before he was detained by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

Why a young KBC contestant's behaviour has put his parents in the firing lineTen-year-old KBC contestant Ishit Bhatt has become the butt of memes and jokes on social media, and the reason is his overconfident demeanour. His parents, too, have been dragged into this, with strangers dissecting their "parenting style" based on a few televised minutes. Is that fair?

Pak plunges into chaos as 15 die in police firing during Islamist party rallyThe march, staged to protest Israeli airstrikes in Gaza and push the government on pro-Palestinian demands, saw violent clashes with a police official and many protesters being killed and injured.

In Israeli parliament, Trump once again claims he stopped India-Pak conflictFor the umpteenth time, US President Donald Trump, speaking in the Israeli parliament, claimed he averted a war between nuclear arch-rivals India and Pakistan following their brief four-day military conflict in May.

Taliban leader's India visit behind deadly Pak-Afghan clashes? | 5 big pointsThe deadly clashes along the Pakistan-Afghanistan Durand Line, sparked by Pakistan's airstrikes targeting TTP militants, have escalated tensions. Both sides reported heavy casualties, and the collective death toll is over 250. Do Pakistan's strikes, which triggered the violence, have anything to do with Afghanistan's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's visit to India?

India's bold push to end power sector woes amidst political freebies | The LowdownThe Draft Electricity (Amendment) Bill 2025 aims to end discom monopolies, phase out cross-subsidies, and usher in private competition. While reform champions foresee efficiency and debt reduction, politically sensitive free electricity schemes could unite both opposition and allies ahead of key elections.

PM skips Gaza peace summit in Sharm el-Sheikh. Who does he not want to meet?Minister of State Kirti Vardhan Singh will represent India at the high-level summit co-chaired by the US and Egyptian Presidents, where over 20 world leaders will meet to finalise the framework of the Gaza peace deal and discuss post-war reconstruction.

Recognise Palestine: Trump heckled in Israeli parliament during Gaza truce speechUS President Donald Trump was heckled by a left-wing member while he was delivering his speech at the Gaza peace deal ceremony at the Israeli parliament. Trump praised the security officials' efficient action to eject the protesting MP.

Live: After Israel, Trump lands in Egypt for Gaza peace deal summitHamas on Monday released the last 20 surviving Israeli hostages under a US-brokered ceasefire deal, marking what President Donald Trump hailed as "a new beginning" and a major step towards ending the two-year Gaza war. The Israeli military confirmed all living hostages had been returned, while buses carrying freed Palestinian prisoners rolled into Gaza to similar emotion. The exchange, the first step in a truce crafted by Trump alongside Egypt, Qatar, and Turkey, comes ahead of a high-stakes summit in Sharm el-Sheikh where over 20 world leaders will discuss Gaza's future under Trump's proposed 20-point peace plan. Stay tuned to India Today for the latest updates as this pivotal day for the Middle East unfolds.

Mamdani faces heat over illegal foreign funds, received 170 donations from abroadNYC mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani faces allegations of accepting $13,000 in illegal foreign donations, including funds from his Dubai-based mother-in-law. An analysis revealed that at least 170 donations to Mamdani's campaign came from outside the US. Mamdani's team has pledged to refund non-compliant funds but offered no explanation for delays.

Texas businessman expelled from church, gym over anti-India immigration postTexas businessman Daniel Keene was expelled from his church and lost $8,000 in sales after his post on X criticising Indian immigrants and H-1B visas went viral. The post, featuring a Ganesh Chaturthi procession, sparked accusations of xenophobia. In his open letter to church, Keene defended his stance and claimed that it was not about preserving the cultural identity of the US.

The village that speaks in Sanskrit : Every. Single. Day.Mattur village in Karnataka has revived Sanskrit as a living language spoken daily. The community blends ancient heritage with modern technology to keep Sanskrit relevant and thriving.

Bengaluru man quits corporate job for family, now earns more as Uber driverA Bengaluru man began his career with Reliance Retail, where he worked for eight years, earning around Rs 40,000 per month. Now, he is an Uber driver and earns Rs 56,000 a month.

Cyrus the Great is Alive: Why Israelis see an ancient Persian king in TrumpIsraelis have likened Donald Trump to the ancient Persian ruler Cyrus the Great, celebrating him as a modern-day liberator who, like Cyrus who ended the Jewish exile in Babylon, has restored Israel's fortunes through his decisive actions.

10 college degrees that no longer pay off, per Harvard reportHarvard economists highlight that the value of some traditional degrees, like computer science, engineering, and business, declines over time due to fast-changing job skills. Facing world No. 1 India provides match intensity and competitive practice ahead of England's historic Test series in Perth.

Gambhir slammed as India's 12-year streak ends in Delhi TestIndia vs West Indies, 2nd Test: Head coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill have faced flak for the decision to enforce follow-on in Delhi. At 14, Vaibhav Suryavanshi becomes vice-captain of Bihar Ranji Trophy teamVaibhav Suryavanshi, 14, has been named vice-captain of Bihar for the first two rounds of Ranji Trophy 2025-26, after exceptional youth performances in Australia, England and the IPL. Sakibul Gani will lead the side as Bihar aims to rebound from a winless previous season.

Zidane confirms eagerness to become France head coach: I'll get backZinedine Zidane has confirmed his ambition to coach the France national team in the future. The former Real Madrid manager remains patient, focusing on returning to management at the right moment.

Harmanpreet Kaur slammed by fans after India's record loss to Australia: Time to goHarmanpreet Kaur is facing severe backlash after India's record World Cup defeat to Australia. Fans questioned her captaincy and poor batting form, demanding leadership changes as India's campaign continues to lose direction.

Alyssa Healy admits Smriti-Pratika had Australia scared in VizagWomen's World Cup, India vs Australia, Alyssa Healy press conference: Australia captain has admitted that she was hanging on for her dear life when India were piling on runs in Vizag. Healy said that sometimes as a captain you only hope that somehow things will get under control.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
